ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Social ontologydifferent philosophical concepts and theories regarding social categories and dynamics, particularly gender (but also sex, race, ability, etc)
Learnt about social ontology, had fascinating discussions on categories such as gender, ability, and race, from a variety of philosophic traditions (analytic, phenomenological).
I learned more about the history of social categorization of gender and race. I learned more about philosophy methods, particularly pertaining to ontology and phemenology.
I learned how to use philosophy to identify and analyze social structures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Prof Dembroff is wonderful, always makes class engaging to a degree I havent experienced with seminars. Readings are not too lengthy but intellectually stimulatingyou will enjoy them if you are interested in the topic. Reading responses were meant to be brief and pointed which I think is the best way to do reading responses in a seminar. Class discussions didnt get overly repetitive and were interesting til the end of the semester. No weaknesses I can think of.

strengths: interesting readings and conversations, amazing professor, liberal format for the final project 
weaknesses: n/a

Professor Dembroff is great, very approachable and kind. They provide a lot of support and facilitate good discussion. I wish that the syllabus didnt move so quickly through topics and we were able to sit with some readings more, but I understand this is a function of the semesters pace.
Excellent readings and seminar leadership by Prof. Dembroff. No improvements necessary!
Class has really interesting material. Discussions are great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely! Dembroff is a gem and facilitates discussion in a gentle but helpful way. Also very good at bringing people together as a community of learners.
Yes. Favorite class Ive taken at Yale
yes! A lovely introduction to philosophy for those interested in the social phenomena that structure our reality, taught by an incredible philosopher.
I would! Discussion in this class was very goodproductive and challenging. This is a valuable place to intellectually and emotionally explore.
Yes! Especially if youre a philosophy student interested in applying philosophy to social issues.

Yes! This is one of the best classes Ive taken at Yale. The level of reading is perfect to have people actually do it and engage but still have more than enough material to discuss. Professor Demvroff is amazing at leading discussion and contributing without being overbearing. The ideas discussed are so interesting and you get to go undo the topics at quite a high level. I really recommend this class to anyone with a background in philosophy.
